possessive determiner &amp; pronoun.description: Belonging to or associated with which person.
examples: a car was parked at the curb and Juliet wondered whose it was

possessive determiner &amp; pronoun.description: Of whom or which (used to indicate that the following noun belongs to or is associated with the person or thing mentioned in the previous clause)
examples: he's a man whose opinion I respect
a willow tree whose branches reached right to the ground

origin: Old English hwæs, genitive of hwā who and hwæt what.
